content: I've done a fair amount of work on Advanced. I've removed all screen captures, as it isn't intended to be basic form filling. The network tech explanations are there but are still duplicated in Connect to - WiFi. That should be fixed. I've still got several FIXME's to handle, but it's reviewable now. The old version is still retained at the end, should you wish to see it.

John, I've made some additional changes to Advanced, editing down the duplicate sections that we had towards the bottom.

Now the only duplicate section is Broadcast and Multicast. I think the bottom version is quite cogent, but the two sections they need to be joined.

Do we need the two FIXME under UDP Protocol ?

Also I have moved two Troubleshooing Connections items to the bottom of the Connections page I am not sure if this is the right place. The second item could be edited down by leaving the CF links, but I think it hangs together better this way, need some objectivity here.

John, for Complex System
I'd like to get this figured out better. What is the goal here? What do we want to show users?
Hopefully it is not too complex. Once we are in agreement, I can do the connections screenshots.

After page is complete, I think we will be ready to ask Steve [twocanplugin] and Hakan wholybee and bfree to review the Connection and Advanced pages.
John, Can we clean up the FIXME at the top of Connections? now?

Rick, I deleted some FIXME content. I don't know if we need a complex system. Maybe for Filtering?
We still need work on NMEA Repeater. I'm trying to get to it.
If you know French this might help http://www.plaisance-pratique.com/OpenCPN-Networking-repeater-to?lang=fr

Rick Gleason said:

If you know French this might help http://www.plaisance-pratique.com/OpenCPN-Networking-repeater-to?lang=fr

That's one of the 2 ca. 2015 links I already found and put into the manual. They are the same content, by the same guy.
I've just cleaned these pages up and labeled them done.
Well, I've updated opencpn:manual_basic:set_options:connections:advanced#udp_nmea_repeater, based upon my tests with two Windows PCs.
Good Thanks John.

John - I've reviewed Advanced. GOOD. I like GPSD illustration and UDP Repeater. John, could we have conceptual diagram for UDP Repeater? I believe that iphones can use VNC and show Opencpn with this setup.

PS I changed the Headings so they read better. Raised the main ones one level.

Sure, I'll make a diagram, if none currently work.

Vnc, might work.

John

Here: https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:quick_start_guide:connect_to:global_navigation_satellite_system

Once again, the linux stuff is áºƒrong: For Linux, open a terminal window and type the command:

To repeat (third time?): There is no need to use the command prompt for regular users. The actual, usable devices are presented in the serial port drop-down. when configuring the device.
Please don't copy-paste outdated stuff.
See https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:quick_start_guide:connect_to:serial_n0183 which is correct but perhaps in need of some editing to fit in the context.
BTW: The FIXME in link above is void. As obvious from screenshot and text stable links a. k. a names are created automatically.

Leamas I am not a linux user, so please just accept that. I have changed the page you noted.
https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:quick_start_guide:connect_to:global_navigation_satellite_system

Where can the Old way of finding serial connections, be moved, in case it is needed?

On this page at the bottom FIXME
https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:quick_start_guide:connect_to:serial_n0183
what do you mean by Void? Do you want that fixme just deleted?

Thanks.
Just remove the first xle
The old way is outdated and should be removed
Since you are not a Linux user the best is perhaps if you dont write it copy- paste stuff. No info is certainly better than wrong info
That is, leave it empty.
On phone ..

Alex, I just copied what you wanted to the Serial-USB section.
The old stuff in Connect to GNSS is just what was left over from the old manual. I never touched it.
The odl manual is, well, old. Not having things in git is admittedly a pain, but still: just remove it.

@John Morfit Here is Steve Adler's response on github.
https://github.com/OpenCPN/OpenCPN/discussions/3776#discussioncomment-9556590
@Alec Leamas To bad you can't edit in Dokuwiki.
